com.wx.crypto

Class Crypter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.crypto.Crypter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CipherCrypter, RSACrypter, SymmetricCrypter

    public abstract class Crypter
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an abstract representation of a Crypter that allows to easily encrypt/decrypt any data.

    Note that the key has to be created before using the encryption/decryption methods.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Crypter

        public Crypter(int... supportedKeyLengths)
        Crypter constructor.
        Note that the first given key will be used as default (if the user did not provide one).
        Parameters:
        supportedKeyLengths - All the supported key lengths for this Crypter

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public byte[] encrypt(java.lang.String plainText)
               throws CryptoException
        Encrypts the given text interpreted in the UTF-8 encoding.

        Note: To use a different encoding, extract bytes yourself and use encrypt(byte[])
        Parameters:
        plainText - Text to encrypt
        Returns:
        Encrypted bytes
        Throws:
        CryptoException

        Note: To use a different encoding, extract bytes yourself and use encrypt(byte[])
        Parameters:

        iv - Initialization vector (might be ignored by some implementations, read documentation)F
        Returns:
        Encrypted bytes

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey(char[] password,
                        byte[] salt)
                 throws CryptoException
        Generate a key by hashing several times the given password. This is the best way to generate key for PBE (Password Based Encryption).
        Parameters:
        password - Password for the key
        salt - Salt for the hashing (recommended to be always different)
        Throws:
        CryptoException

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey(char[] password,
                        byte[] salt,
                        int iterationsCount)
                 throws CryptoException
        Generate a key by hashing several times the given password. This is the best way to generate key for PBE (Password Based Encryption).
        Parameters:
        password - Password for the key
        salt - Salt for the hashing (recommended to be always different)
        iterationsCount - Number of times the key will be hashed
        Throws:
        CryptoException

      • generateKey

        public void generateKey(char[] password,
                        byte[] salt,
                        int iterationsCount,
                        java.lang.String hashAlgorithm)
                 throws CryptoException
        Generate a key by hashing several times the given password. This is the best way to generate key for PBE (Password Based Encryption).
        Parameters:
        password - Password for the key
        salt - Salt for the hashing (recommended to be always different)
        iterationsCount - Number of times the key will be hashed
        hashAlgorithm - Hash algorithm
        Throws:
        CryptoException

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.io.InputStream in,
                                          byte[] iv,
                                          boolean encrypt)
                                   throws CryptoException
        Gets an input stream implementing this Crypter algorithm.
        Parameters:
        in - Input stream that will be wrapped
        iv - Initialization vector (might be ignored by some implementations, read documentation)
        encrypt - true to set this Crypter to encrypt mode
        Returns:
        An Crypter input stream
        Throws:
        CryptoException

        public void setKeyLength(int keyLength)

        Set the key length (in bits).

        Note that a default key length is always automatically set.
        Parameters:
        keyLength - New key length
        Throws:

                                  byte[] iv,
                                  boolean encrypt)
                           throws CryptoException
        Perform a simple encryption or decryption on the given data.
        Parameters:
        data - Data to process
        iv - Initialization vector
        encrypt - true for encryption

        CryptoException
